patents.title: Session-Based Data Storage for Chat-Based Communication Sessions
patents.description: This patent describes session-based data storage for chat-based communication sessions using data storage slots that persist throughout conversations. The system supports three event types—data capture, retrieval, and prefill—enabling chatbots to store both static values and dynamic expressions from session context, external sources, and user responses without redundant questioning.
patents.impact: The technology eliminates repetitive information requests in chatbot interactions, providing seamless handoffs to human agents with complete context preservation. Platform-agnostic design enables consistent data handling across diverse conversation applications, significantly reducing customer frustration while improving resolution times and creating more natural, efficient dialogues between users and virtual assistants.
patents.technical_details: Data storage slots contain slot identifiers, values (static or Handlebars dynamic expressions), and lifecycle flags determining single-use or session-persistence. Slots reside in the chatbot's state cache (state.nlp.sessionSlots.*). The data event processing module validates existing data, retrieves external information via API calls, and captures user responses for workflow progression.

patents.title: Systems and Methods for Bot Dialog Delegation
patents.description: This patent describes a dialog delegation processor enabling seamless switching between multiple natural language processing units during chatbot interactions. The system uses intent declarations to route user utterances to specialized NLP processors, maintaining conversation state and incomprehension counters while providing transparent handoffs between different chatbots without user awareness.
patents.impact: The technology eliminates user navigation between different chatbots and reduces development redundancy by enabling conversational flow reuse across organizations. It improves task completion by routing requests to the most capable NLP unit for each intent, while incomprehension handling with escalation protocols ensures appropriate assistance even when automated systems fail.
patents.technical_details: The architecture uses a server computing device with multiple NLP processors, each configured with specific intent definitions. The dialog delegation processor maintains conversation state and active transcripts in a content store, employs recursion for nested delegations, and uses configuration objects with dialogId, triggerUtterance, and runtime flags to manage seamless transitions between specialized processors.

patents.title: GraphQL Gateway-as-a-Service Architecture
patents.description: A comprehensive platform architecture for providing GraphQL gateway services as a managed, self-service infrastructure. The invention addresses the complexity of deploying, managing, and scaling GraphQL gateways in enterprise environments. It includes automated provisioning, federation management, security controls, and observability features.
patents.impact: Simplifies GraphQL Federation adoption at the enterprise level, reducing time-to-production from months to days. The architecture enables automatic scaling, zero-downtime deployments, and centralized governance while maintaining team autonomy. With the potential to serve millions of requests daily.
patents.technical_details: The system employs a control plane/data plane architecture where the control plane handles gateway lifecycle management, configuration, and monitoring, while the data plane processes actual GraphQL requests. It includes intelligent routing, caching strategies, and automatic schema composition from federated services.
